channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2024050126
item.description:
Report E-2024050126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-05
  • City: MORENCI
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: After loading materials, the driver did not verify all connections were removed before attempting to leave and left the loading arm attached to the trailer. Due to this, the API valve broke off and allowed unprompted release of materials.

item.title: Report X-2024051365
item.description:
Report X-2024051365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: KINGMAN
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024051365 attachment Name:100663.pdf 2. X-2024051374 Pkg is undeclared Hazmat. There are no markings on the outside of the pkg. There were 2 bottles of Reagent Probe Cleaner with cracked lids that leaked inside of pkg. Items were loosely packed inside of pkg. The sample Probe Cleaner DID NOT leak at all; however, this product shows it being a hazmat as well. I have attached both SDS for the products that were in the pkg. External container was wet and crushed before it came off preload trailer
